Text saved: Asteroids are big rocks in space. Some of these rocks can be dangerous to Earth. If they fly near Earth, we call them 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' (PHAs). 'Near' means less than 7.5 million kilometres away. NASA made a map of 1,400 PHAs. But none of them is a danger for the next 100 years. NASA has technology to follow these objects. It can see if an asteroid is going to hit Earth. If an asteroid becomes a danger, NASA has two ways to protect us.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text demonstrates excellent simplification of sentence structure and complex ideas. However, it fails due to a single vocabulary error. The word 'protect' is B1 level. A strict A2 text cannot contain B1 vocabulary, even if the meaning is clear. An alternative such as 'keep us safe' or 'stop the danger' would have been compliant. This single error makes the entire text a failure.
